document.masterDocTitle: On the identity of Otiorhynchus (Nihus) subcostatus STIERLIN, 1866, description of Otiorhynchus muffi sp. nov., and an illustrated key to the species of Nihus REITTER, 1912 with taxonomic comments on both the subgenera Nihus and Eunihus REITTER, 1912 (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the identity of Otiorhynchus (Nihus) subcostatus STIERLIN, 1866, description of Otiorhynchus muffi sp. nov., and an illustrated key to the species of Nihus REITTER, 1912 with taxonomic comments on both the subgenera Nihus and Eunihus REITTER, 1912 (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Stierlin, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Stierlin, G. (1866): Zweiter Nachtrag zur Revision der europaischen Otiorhynchus - Arten. - Berliner Entomologische Zeitschrift 10: 129 - 135.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 16–18. Genital structures of
O. muffi
sp. nov. 16. Spiculum ventrale, 17. Spermatheca, 18. Ovipositor. Illustrations by Olena Domschke.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks: A series of specimens of
O. subcostatus
from Alp Flix ( Switzerland , Grisons ) with the following data: 6 ♀ GR, Alp Flix, Salategnas, 1960 m , 24. 7.–21.8.2005 , leg. P. Muff ( NMBE ), and a single female specimen from Italy , Trentino with the data: Trentino, Gampenjoch, 6. 2004, leg. Grunwald ( SDEI ) are constantly bigger and more robust, which might indicate the presence of polyploidy, shown in the case of
O. carinatopunctatus
by Suomalainen (1969) .
